text: Thomas Starr King is a sculpture depicting the American minister of the same name by Haig Patigian, formerly installed in the United States Capitol's rotunda, in Washington, D.C., as part of the National Statuary Hall Collection. The statue, which had been donated by the U.S. state of California in 1931, was replaced by one depicting Ronald Reagan in 2009. ==References== Category:1931 sculptures King Category:Relocated buildings and structures in the United States Category:Sculptures of men in the United States Category:Statues in the United States
title: Thomas Starr King (Patigian)
